channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is killed in Israeli strike, ending 36-year iron rule
item.description: Khamenei, the Islamic Republic's second supreme leader, has been killed. He had held power since 1989, guiding Iran through difficult times — and overseeing the violent suppression of dissent.
item.content:encoded:
Khamenei, the Islamic Republic's second supreme leader, has been killed. He had held power since 1989, guiding Iran through difficult times — and overseeing the violent suppression of dissent.

(Image credit: Atta Kenare)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: 'One year of failure.' The Lancet slams RFK Jr.'s first year as health chief
item.description: In a scathing review, the top US medical journal's editorial board warned that the "destruction that Kennedy has wrought in 1 in office might take generations to repair."
item.content:encoded:
In a scathing review, the top US medical journal's editorial board warned that the "destruction that Kennedy has wrought in 1 in office might take generations to repair."

(Image credit: Ben curtis)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Here's how world leaders are reacting to the US-Israel strikes on Iran
item.description: Several leaders voiced support for the operation – but most, including those who stopped short of condemning it, called for restraint moving forward.
item.content:encoded:
Several leaders voiced support for the operation – but most, including those who stopped short of condemning it, called for restraint moving forward.

(Image credit: Alastair Grant)
item.dc:creator: NPR's International Desk

item.title: How could the U.S. strikes in Iran affect the world's oil supply?
item.description: Despite sanctions, Iran is one of the world's major oil producers, with much of its crude exported to China.
item.content:encoded:
Despite sanctions, Iran is one of the world's major oil producers, with much of its crude exported to China.

(Image credit: SAM/Middle East Images)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: What to know about the U.S. and Israeli attacks on Iran
item.description: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was killed in Israeli airstrikes with U.S. support on Saturday. "Operation Epic Fury" will be "massive and ongoing," President Trump said.
item.content:encoded:
Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was killed in Israeli airstrikes with U.S. support on Saturday. "Operation Epic Fury" will be "massive and ongoing," President Trump said.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Opinion: The Chicago Bears of Indiana
item.description: A storied football team may be moving out of Illinois. Will fans of the Chicago Bears stick with them when they become the Hammond Bears?
item.content:encoded:
A storied football team may be moving out of Illinois. Will fans of the Chicago Bears stick with them when they become the Hammond Bears?

(Image credit: Quinn Harris/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Iran strikes were launched without approval from Congress, deeply dividing lawmakers
item.description: Top lawmakers were notified about the operation shortly before it was launched, but the White House did not seek authorization from Congress to carry out the strikes.
item.content:encoded:
Top lawmakers were notified about the operation shortly before it was launched, but the White House did not seek authorization from Congress to carry out the strikes.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Unlocking the secrets of an ancient plague
item.description: The first historically recorded pandemic is believed to have struck the walled city of Jirash, in what is now modern-day Jordan, in the 7th century. A new study reveals details about those who died.
item.content:encoded:
The first historically recorded pandemic is believed to have struck the walled city of Jirash, in what is now modern-day Jordan, in the 7th century. A new study reveals details about those who died.

(Image credit: Gatsi)
item.dc:creator: Durrie Bouscaren

item.title: Panic, fury, and some hope, in Iran as U.S. launches strikes
item.description: In Tehran, panicked residents rushed home to shelter and terrified children poured out of classrooms as U.S. air strikes hit the capitol.
item.content:encoded: In Tehran, panicked residents rushed home to shelter and terrified children poured out of classrooms as U.S. air strikes hit the capitol.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: North Carolina Democrats latest to chart future of the party in congressional primary
item.description: In a safe Democratic seat in North Carolina, a match-up between a two-term Congresswoman and a progressive local official show how Democrats are charting the future of their party in the age of Trump.
item.content:encoded:
In a safe Democratic seat in North Carolina, a match-up between a two-term Congresswoman and a progressive local official show how Democrats are charting the future of their party in the age of Trump.

(Image credit: Jonathan Drake/Reuters; Andrew Harnik/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Colin Campbell
